message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken

<<<code>>>: 
```java
String email = "ihnel48@gmail.com";
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(email, "@.");
List<String> tokens = new ArrayList<>();
while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
    tokens.add(st.nextToken());
}
```

<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class in Java is used to break a string into tokens. In this case, we are using it to break the email string into parts. We specify "@." as the delimiter, which means the string will be split at each occurrence of "@" or ".". The tokens are then added to a list. The resulting list will contain the parts of the email as separate elements.
